name: manganese(III) oxide production | manganese(III) oxide | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/2063/documentation

The dataset can be used for example as base material in the production of spinell type lithium manganese oxide Data are based on patents. ;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



This dataset includes rosting of manganese carbonate in a rotary kiln in a specified nitrogen/oxygen-atmosphere.  Energy consumption, carbon monoxide and carbon dioxide emissions to air are calculated. For infrastructure, the ecoinvent dataset "chemical plant, organics" is accounted. Transportation efforts are based on ecoinvent standard estimates.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Some Swiss or European datasets are used for global processes.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This dataset includes rosting of manganese carbonate in a rotary kiln at temperatures around 500Â°C. Assumption: CO to the atmosphere is equal to the CO after thermal post-combustion (<20mgC/Nm3). No infrastructure for thermal post combustion an no heat through the burning process of CO is calculated.
